page.title: 01Tower Hamlets
page.content:
ur 4 x 3 km square falls largely in an rea of London called Tower Hamlets.The 3 easternmost squares cross into Newham Our square is mainly residential but is also known for 'homework'-people work at home on garments etc which are then taken to factories for completion.There has been alot of rebuilding since the 2nd World War but this is now in need of substancial repair.There is a mix of housing types from Georgian to modern. The 4 southernmost squares cross into the Enterprise Zone of London Docklands which may create more jobs in an area which has lost many in recent years due to dock closures.Transport services are adequate but could be geared more to the needs of the local people.The area is multi-cultural.It is also one of the poorest boroughs in London.
David MacDonald
